title: Father charged in shooting death of 3-year-old boy in Detroit appears in court
content:
DETROIT (WXYZ) - Curry Bryson, the father of the 11-year-old who police say shot and killed a 3-year-old, appeared in court today for a hearing.
His preliminary hearing is scheduled for September 8 at 1:30 p.m.
Bryson of Detroit is facing manslaughter, child abuse, and gun charges.
“He’s devastated,” said Jerome Barney, his defense attorney.
Barney says it is not the charges against him that have torn his client apart. It is the fact Bryson’s 11-year-old son is accused of shooting and killing 3-year-old Elijah Walker.
“He’s distraught over the death of this baby, his girlfriend’s little boy,” said Barney.
It’s a death prosecutors say this dad is responsible for because he left his gun unsecured. Investigators say the 11-year-old took the gun from dad’s closet. He later shot Elijah in the face.
It happened on Aug. 3 at dad’s house on Eastwood Street in Detroit.
The 11-year-old was also charged days later as a juvenile with manslaughter and gun charges.
Bryson's bond was set at $10,000, ten percent.
